thread.title: Swansea v Leicester: Claudio Ranieri pressure ramps up after own caught looking unimpressed | Metro News
thread.title_full: Swansea v Leicester: Claudio Ranieri pressure ramps up after own caught looking unimpressed | Metro News

author: Simon Rice For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Swansea v Leicester: Claudio Ranieri pressure ramps up after own caught looking unimpressed | Metro News
text:
Simon Rice for Metro.co.uk Sunday 12 Feb 2017 5:22 pm Claudio Ranieri watches his side in action against Swansea (Getty) 
Leicester gave Claudio Ranieri a vote of confidence in midweek, releasing a statement insisting they back the Italian despite speculation of unrest behind the scenes. 
The Foxes hierarchy would have hoped the show of unity would transfer to the pitch and spark an upturn in results. However there was no sign of that in the Premier League meeting with Swansea where the champions found themselves 2-0 down at half-time. Mesut Ozil suffering CRISIS of confidence, admits Arsenal boss Wenger 
After the second goal went in the camera focused in on owner Vichai Srivaddhanaprabha, and despite what was said in midweek, he looked far from impressed by what he watching. The Thai was spotted shaking his head as he looked on at the Liberty Stadium. Vichai Srivaddhanaprabha, who is chairman as well as owner, did not look pleased (Sky Sports) 
Having beaten odds of 5000/1 to land the title last season Leicesterâ€™s demise this term has been spectacular. They are still yet to win a league match on the road this season and find themselves one point above the relegation zone.
